englishTranslationText: “And	also	our	forefathers?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kyā		hamāre	agle	bāp	dada	bhi.

englishTranslationText: Proclaim,	“Yes,	and	with	disgrace.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	farmāō	hāñ	yoñ	ke	ƶalil	ho	ke.

arabicText: فَإِنَّمَا هِىَ زَجْرَةٌۭ وَٰحِدَةٌۭ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
englishTranslationText: So	that	is	just	a	single	jolt,	thereupon	they	will	begin	staring.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	woh	aik	hi	jhidak	hai	jabhi	woh	dekhne	lageñ	ge.

englishTranslationText: And	will	say,	“O	our	misfortune!”	It	will	be	said	to	them,	“This	is	the	Day	of	Justice.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kahēñ	ge	hāye	hamāri	kharābi	un	se	kahā	jāye	gā	ye	insāf	kā	din	hai.	.

arabicText: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
englishTranslationText: “This	is	the	Day	of	Judgement,	which	you	used	to	deny!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ye	hai	woh	faisle	kā	din	jise	tum	jhutlāte	the.

arabicText: ۞ ٱحْشُرُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ وَأَزْوَٰجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْبُدُونَ
englishTranslationText: “Gather	all	the	unjust	persons	and	their	spouses,	and	all	that	they	used	to	worship!”-
romanUrduTranslationText: Zālimoñ	aur	un	ke	jodoñ	ko	aur	jo	kuch	woh	poojte	the.

arabicText: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
englishTranslationText: “Instead	of	Allah	-	and	herd	them	to	the	path	leading	to	hell.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Allāh	ke	siwā	un	sab	ko	hāñko	rāh-e-dozakh	ki	ṭaraf.

englishTranslationText: “And	stop	them	-	they	are	to	be	questioned.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	unheñ	thahrāō	un	se	pooñchnā	hai.

englishTranslationText:
“What	is	the	matter	with	you,	that	you	do	
not	help	one	another?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tumheñ	kyā		huā	aik	dosre	ki	madad	kiyoñ	
nahiñ	karte.

englishTranslationText: In	fact	this	day	they	have	all	surrendered.
romanUrduTranslationText: Balke	woh	āaj	gardan	dale	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: And	some	of	them	incline
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	meiñ	aik	ne	dosre	ki	ṭaraf	moñh	
kiyā		āapas	meiñ	pooñchte	huye.

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
englishTranslationText:
And	some	of	them	inclined	towards	others,	
mutually	questioning.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	meiñ	aik	ne	dosre	ki	ṭaraf	moñh	
kiyā		āapas	meiñ	pooñchte	huye.

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“It	is	you	who	used	to	come	to	
us	from	our	right,	in	order	to	sway.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	tum	hamāre	dahni	ṭaraf	se	bahkāne	
āate	the.

englishTranslationText:
They	will	answer,	“You	yourselves	did	not	
have	faith!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jawāb	deñ	ge	tum	khud	hi	Imān	na	rakhte	
the.

arabicText: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَـٰنٍۭ ۖ بَلْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًۭا طَـٰغِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hamārā	tum	par	kuch	qābo	na	thā	
balke	tum	sarkash	log	the.

arabicText: فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَآ ۖ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“So	the	Word	of	our	Lord	has	proved	true	
upon	us;	we	will	surely	have	to	taste	(the 
punishment).”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	sābit	ho	gayi	ham	par	hamāre	Rab	ki	bāt	
hameñ	zaroor	chakhnā	hai

englishTranslationText:
“We	therefore	led	you	astray,	for	we	
ourselves	were	astray!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	ham	ne	tumheñ	gumrāh	kiyā	ke	ham	
khud	gumrāh	the.

englishTranslationText:
So	this	day	they	all	are	partners	in	the	
punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	us	din	woh	sab	ke	sab	‘aƶāb	meiñ	sharik	
haiñ.

englishTranslationText: This	is	how	We	deal	with	the	guilty.
romanUrduTranslationText: Mujrimoñ	ke	sāth	ham	aisā	hi	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوٓا۟ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed,	when	it	was	said	to	them,	“There	is	
no	God	except	Allah”,	they	were	haughty.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	jab	un	se	kahā	jātā	thā	ke	Allāh	ke	
siwā	kisi	ki	bandagi	nahiñ	to	ooñche	
khiñchte	(takabbur	karte)	the.

arabicText: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍۢ مَّجْنُونٍۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	used	to	say,	“Shall	we	forsake	our	
Gods	upon	the	sayings	of	a	mad	poet?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kahte	the	kyā		ham	apne	khudāōñ	ko	
chod	deñ	aik	diwāna	shā’ir	ke	kahne	se.

englishTranslationText:
In	fact	he	has	brought	the	Truth,	and	
testified	for	the	Noble	Messengers!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	woh	to	ḥaq	lāye	haiñ	aur	unhoñ	ne	
Rasooloñ	ki	tasdiq	farmāyi.

englishTranslationText:
“You	surely	have	to	taste	the	painful	
punishment.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	tumheñ	zaroor	dukh	ki	mār	
chakhni	hai.

arabicText: وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	you	will	not	be	compensated	except	
for	your	deeds.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	tumheñ	badla	na	mile	gā	magar	apne	
kiye	kā.

englishTranslationText: Except	the	chosen	bondmen	of	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText: Magar	jo	Allah	ke	chune	huye	bande	haiñ.
